name: Potato Latkes
description: Crispy Jewish potato pancakes made with grated potatoes and onions, traditionally served during Hanukkah.

ingredients.item: 2 large Russet potatoes (about 1 pound), scrubbed and cut lengthwise into quarters
ingredients.name: Russet potatoes (about 1 pound), scrubbed and cut lengthwise into quarters

ingredients.item: 1 large onion (8 ounces), peeled and cut into quarters
ingredients.name: onion (8 ounces), peeled and cut into quarters

ingredients.item: 2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt (or 1 teaspoon fine sea salt), plus more for sprinkling
ingredients.name: coarse kosher salt (or 1 teaspoon fine sea salt), plus more for sprinkling

ingredients.item: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
ingredients.name: freshly ground black pepper

instructions: Using a food processor with a coarse grating disc, grate the potatoes and onion. Transfer the mixture to a clean dishtowel and squeeze and wring out as much of the liquid as possible.
Working quickly, transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Add the eggs, flour, salt, baking powder and pepper, and mix until the flour is absorbed.

In a medium heavy-bottomed pan over medium-high heat, pour in about 1/4 inch of the oil. Once the oil is hot (a drop of batter placed in the pan should sizzle), use a heaping tablespoon to drop the batter into the hot pan, cooking in batches. Use a spatula to flatten and shape the drops into discs. When the edges of the latkes are brown and crispy, about 5 minutes, flip. Cook until the second side is deeply browned, about another 5 minutes. Transfer the latkes to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and sprinkle with salt while still warm. Repeat with the remaining batter.
